against.translation[0].definitions[0].de: used to say that someone opposes or disagrees with something
against.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Every council member voted against the proposal.
those who are campaigning against the new road
Mr Howard has declared that he is against all forms of racism.
against.translation[0].definitions[1].de: used to say that an action is not wanted or approved of by someone
against.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: They got married against her parents’ wishes (=although they knew her parents did not want them to).
She has been kept in the house against her will (=she does not want to stay in the house).
The use of certain drugs is against the law (=illegal).
It’s against my principles to borrow money  (=I do not believe it is right).
against.translation[0].definitions[2].de: used to say that something is not allowed by a law or rule
against.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: There ought to be a law against it.
against.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used to say who someone is competing with or trying to defeat in a game, battle etc
against.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Gambotti was injured in last Saturday’s game against the Lions.
We’ll be competing against the best companies in Europe.
against.translation[0].definitions[4].de: used to say who is harmed, threatened, or given a disadvantage
against.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: There had been death threats against prison staff.
Your lack of experience could count against you.
The regulations tend to work against smaller companies.
against.translation[0].definitions[5].de: used to say that something touches, hits, or rubs a surface
against.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: the sound of the rain drumming against my window
The car skidded and we could hear the crunch of metal against metal.
against.translation[0].definitions[6].de: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support
against.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.
The younger policeman was leaning against the bureau with his arms folded.
against.translation[0].definitions[7].de: in the opposite direction to the movement or flow of something
against.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: She dived down and swam out strongly against the current.
against.translation[0].definitions[8].de: seen with something else behind or as a background
against.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: He could see a line of figures silhouetted against the sky.
It is important to know what colours look good against your skin.
against.translation[0].definitions[9].de: used to show that you are considering particular events in relation to other events that are happening at the same time
against.translation[0].definitions[9].ex: The reforms were introduced against a background of social unrest.
against.translation[0].definitions[10].d: used to say what you are comparing something with
against.translation[0].definitions[10].e: The pound has fallen 10% against the dollar.
She checked the contents of the box against the list.
The cost of the proposed research needs to be balanced against its benefits.
against.translation[0].definitions[11].d: used to say who or what you are trying to protect someone or something from
against.translation[0].definitions[11].e: a cream to protect against sunburn
a vaccine which is effective against pneumonia
against.translation[0].definitions[12].d: used to say who is said or shown to have done something wrong
against.translation[0].definitions[12].e: He has always emphatically denied the allegations against him.
The evidence against you is overwhelming.
